Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

As <FI>when<Fi> the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, <FI>that<Fi> the nations may tremble at thy presence!<RF>the melting…: Heb. the fire of meltings<Rf>
When thou didst terrible things <FI>which<Fi> we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

For since the beginning of the world <FI>men<Fi> have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, <FI>what<Fi> he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.<RF>seen…: or, seen a God beside thee, which doeth so for him, etc<Rf>

Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, <FI>those that<Fi> remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.<CM>
But we are all as an unclean <FI>thing<Fi>, and all our righteousnesses <FI>are<Fi> as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

And <FI>there is<Fi> none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.<RF>consumed: Heb. melted<Rf><RF>because: Heb. by the hand<Rf>
But now, O LORD, thou <FI>art<Fi> our father; we <FI>are<Fi> the clay, and thou our potter; and we all <FI>are<Fi> the work of thy hand.
Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we <FI>are<Fi> all thy people.
Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.
Wilt thou refrain thyself for these <FI>things<Fi>, O LORD? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?<CM>
